availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, attorney. Virginia native. Married Nancy Hooe. Married Susan Hooe. Father of Joseph A Hooe, Jennie Hooe, Edmund B Hooe, Robert M Hooe, William A Hooe, Emmet M Hooe, Frank Hooe, Nannie Hooe, Willie Hooe. Owned two enslaved people in Mercer County in 1860. Lawyer in Mercer County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, p. 273A
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, pp. 711-712
